comment.author: 69746795@N05
comment._content: Fremantle, yet named after Capt Freemantle

comment.author: 92581505@N02
comment._content: The Mast seen in the background still stands, it is in front of the convict built 'round house' (early prison).

comment.author: 32945250@N08
comment._content: most of what you see here was demolished and the head cut away to make room for the south quay and boat sheds when CY O'Connor opened up the Swan River mouth to build Fremantle Harbour, The Round House can barely be seen in this shot in the background near the signal flagpole. The rough railway runs from Bathers Beach.

comment.author: 31575009@N05
comment._content: Thank you for your comments. I have updated the description for this image with the correct spelling
